Legal_Issue: Was the officer's internal flight alternative (IFA) finding reasonable given the applicant's daughter's medical needs?
Evidence_Assessment: Evidence showed barriers to cancer treatment in India, making the IFA unreasonable
Decision_Outcome: The officer concluded Mumbai was a viable IFA
Legal_Rule: The IFA test requires: (1) no serious possibility of persecution, and (2) conditions must not make it unreasonable for the claimant to seek refuge there.
Grounds_for_Claim: Specialized medical needs of the applicant's daughter
Outcome_on_Merits: The Federal Court found the IFA decision unreasonable
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Assessed as part of judicial review
Key_Evidence_Considered: Barriers to accessing cancer treatment in Mumbai, India
Legal_Framework: Pre-removal risk assessment (PRRA), Internal Flight Alternative (IFA)
Applicant_Challenge: Challenge to the refusal of PRRA based on IFA in Mumbai
Court_Result: Judicial review allowed; PRRA decision remitted to a different officer
Legal_Rule_Source: Federal Court jurisprudence on IFA and PRRA
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Risk related to daughterâ€™s medical needs if returned to Mumbai
Governing_Rule: Internal Flight Alternative doctrine in Canadian immigration law
